item.title: ILS Antenna Switching – Glide Slope (GS) Two or Three Inoperative

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided approach minimums do not require use of the associated ILS Glide Slope receiver.

note.para: If Left Glide Slope switching is inoperative, GPWS Mode 5 is considered inoperative.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Confirm that the associated GS receiver is not required for planned approach minimums.
If the left GS is inoperative, GPWS mode 5 (GS Deviation) will be inoperative. The flight crew should observe the following:
Flight crew should be vigilant monitoring aircraft altitude and flight path.
Flight crew should use all systems available to include the use of autopilot, auto land, ILS, FMCS to include RNAV/GPS.
Modify Approach Briefing appropriate for the existing meteorological conditions.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ GLIDE SLOPE(S) INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
